definition: An ancient calculating tool consisting of beads on rods.
A summary of the contents of a book, article, or speech.
A process or set of rules to be followed in problem-solving operations.
The action or process of distributing something.
Detailed examination of elements or structure of something.
A mobile operating system developed by Google.
A TypeScript-based open-source web application framework.
The technique of photographing successive drawings or positions of models to create an illusion of movement.
Application Programming Interface, a set of functions for building applications.
A round fruit with red, green, or yellow skin.
A formal request, or a program designed for end users.
An ordered series or arrangement.
A symbol (→) used to show direction or position.
A low-level programming language.
The basic unit of a chemical element.
A quality or feature regarded as a characteristic of someone or something.
The process of verifying the identity of a user or process.
The use of technology to perform tasks without human intervention.
The server side of a software application.
The maximum rate of data transfer across a network path.
A system of numerical notation that has 2 rather than 10 as a base.
A type of digital currency in which records are maintained by a decentralized system.
A system in which records are maintained across linked peer-to-peer networks.
A binary variable with two possible values: true or false.
A free front-end framework for faster web development.
A program used to access the internet (e.g., Chrome, Firefox).
An error in a computer program.
A unit of digital information that consists of 8 bits.
A hardware or software component that stores data for future requests.
An instruction that tells a program to execute a function or procedure.
A function passed into another function as an argument to be executed later.
A device used to capture images or videos.
An HTML element used to draw graphics on a web page.
A challenge–response test to determine whether a user is human.
The smallest structural and functional unit of an organism.
A blueprint for creating objects in programming.
Command Line Interface, a way to interact with a computer program.
A computer or software that requests a service from a server.
Computing services delivered over the internet.
A group of linked computers working together.
A system of words, letters, or symbols used to represent instructions.
A program that converts instructions into machine code.
The process of reducing the size of data.
An electronic device for storing and processing data.
A statement that must be true for certain code to execute.
A value that does not change during program execution.
A special method used to initialize objects in object-oriented programming.
A small file stored on a user’s computer by a web browser.
Central Processing Unit, the main processor of a computer.
Cascading Style Sheets, used to style HTML documents.
An organized collection of structured information stored electronically.
The process of identifying and removing errors from software.
A number system based on ten.
The process of converting encrypted data back into readable form.
A preselected option adopted by a system when no alternative is specified.
The process of making a software application available for use.
A piece of software required by another to function properly.
The process of creating a plan for a software system or interface.
A personal computer intended for regular use at a single location.
A piece of equipment made for a particular purpose.
A simplified drawing showing the appearance or workings of something.
A precious stone consisting of a clear and colorless crystalline form of carbon.
Involving or relating to the use of computer technology.
An instruction or order issued by a software framework or system.
A flat, circular plate storing digital data.
Domain Name System, which translates domain names into IP addresses.
A written, printed, or electronic piece of information.
An address where Internet users can access a website.
Software that controls a hardware component.
A percussion instrument sounded by being struck.
Characterized by constant change or activity; in computing, refers to runtime behavior.
A large bird of prey with broad wings and a hooked beak.
Commercial transactions conducted electronically on the Internet.
The boundary or outer part of an area; also a web browser by Microsoft.
A program used for creating or modifying text or code.
Capable of adapting quickly; in computing, refers to scalable cloud resources.
A lightweight framework for building cross-platform apps with JavaScript.
Messages distributed by electronic means from one computer user to another.
To insert one item into another; in computing, placing code or media inside a file.
The process of converting information into code to prevent unauthorized access.
A specific URL where an API can access the resources it needs.
A machine that converts power into motion; in computing, a core software component.
An object that exists independently, especially in a database context.
The conditions or setting in which a program operates.
An action or occurrence detected by a program.
An error or unusual condition encountered during program execution.
The process of carrying out program instructions.
A web application framework for Node.js.
Material produced by weaving fibers; in computing, a network design.
A JavaScript function used to make network requests.
A thread-like structure; in computing, refers to lightweight execution threads.
A single piece of data in a database record.
A collection of data stored with a name and extension.
A process that removes unwanted data.
A security system that controls incoming and outgoing network traffic.
Software programmed onto hardware devices.
A variable used to signal a condition in programming.
A diagram that represents a process or workflow.
A container used to organize files.
A set of characters of a particular design and size.
A control flow statement for specifying iteration in programming.
A document with spaces to input data.
A platform providing a foundation and structure for software development.
A block of organized, reusable code used to perform a task.
A device that connects different networks.
A unit of digital information equal to about one billion bytes.
A distributed version control system.
A spherical representation of the Earth or heavens.
Graphics Processing Unit, specialized for rendering images.
A diagram representing data or relationships.
A network of evenly spaced lines, often used in layouts.
A stringed musical instrument.
A tool with a heavy head used for striking.
A person skilled in using computers, sometimes illegally.
The physical components of a computer system.
A function that converts input data into a fixed-size value.
Information at the beginning of a data block or file.
A hard or padded protective hat.
A computer that provides data or services to others.
A building for human habitation.

Hypertext Transfer Protocol, foundation of web communication.
Frozen water.
Integrated Development Environment, software for coding.
A data structure that improves database search speed.
A colored fluid used for writing, printing, or drawing.
Data entered into a computer system.
A single occurrence of an object or process.
A whole number without a fractional part.
A point where two systems interact.
A global network connecting millions of computers.
A program that executes instructions directly without compiling.
Internet Protocol, the method for addressing and routing packets.
A piece of land surrounded by water.
The repetition of a process or set of instructions.
An outer garment extending to the waist or hips.

A programming language for web development.
A daily record of events or personal experiences.
JavaScript Object Notation for lightweight data exchange.
An area of land overgrown with dense forest and tangled vegetation.
The core of an operating system managing resources.
An input device with keys used to enter data.
A frame that defines the start or end of a transition in animation.
A container for boiling water.
A room where food is prepared and cooked.
A toy with a light frame and fabric, flown in the air.
A device for giving light, using electricity, gas, or oil.
The time delay between a request and its response.
A collection of precompiled routines or a place with books.
An open-source operating system kernel.
A large tawny-colored wild cat that lives in prides.
To transfer data or programs into memory for execution.
The process of gaining access to a system using credentials.
A programming construct that repeats a block of code.
A device with moving parts that performs tasks.
A single instruction that expands into a set of instructions.
Software designed to disrupt or damage a computer system.
A handbook or guide providing instructions.
A diagrammatic representation of land, data, or concepts.
A system for annotating text, such as HTML.
A rectangular array of numbers or data.
Storage for data and instructions in a computer.
To combine two or more sets of data.
Data that provides information about other data.
A function defined within a class in programming.
A device that converts sound into electrical signals.
Software that connects different applications or systems.
A representation or simulation of a system.
A device that transmits digital data over telephone lines.
A self-contained unit of code or function.
A device used to display computer output.
A hand-held pointing device for computers.
The use of text, audio, video, and graphics together.
A container that holds identifiers to avoid conflicts.
A group of interconnected computers or devices.
A point in a network where connections intersect.
A portable personal computer.
A special value representing 'no value' or 'nothing'.
A mathematical object used to count, measure, and label.
An instance of a class in programming.
Not connected to a network or the internet.
Connected to or available through the internet.
Software with source code freely available for modification.
A symbol that represents a computation in programming.
A choice or alternative in a menu or program.
The information produced by a computer.
An error when a calculation exceeds memory capacity.
A formatted unit of data carried by a network.
A variable passed to a function.
A program that analyzes code into components.
A secret string for authentication.
A fix or update for a software program.
A directory location of a file or folder.
Portable Document Format, a file format for documents.
An external device connected to a computer.
A fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information.
The smallest unit of a digital image.
The hardware or software environment for applications.
A software component that adds features to a program.
A variable that stores a memory address.
A communication endpoint in a network or a physical interface.
An instance of a running program.
A set of instructions for a computer to execute.
A set of rules for data communication.
A server that acts as an intermediary for requests.
A request for information from a database.
A data structure that follows First-In-First-Out order.
Random Access Memory, temporary storage used by a computer.
A process where a function calls itself.
To send a request to a different URL or location.
A database in Windows OS that stores configuration settings.
A storage location for software packages or code.
Representational State Transfer, an architectural style for APIs.
A device that forwards data packets between networks.
The period when a program is executing.
A testing environment isolated from the live system.
The ability of a system to handle growth in workload.
A device that converts physical documents into digital format.
The structure or organization of a database.
A set of instructions executed by a program or interpreter.
Software Development Kit, tools for building applications.
The process of looking for information in data or files.
Measures taken to protect systems and data from threats.
The meaning or interpretation of elements in programming or language.
A computer that provides services or resources to clients.
A temporary interaction between a client and server.
A user interface for accessing operating system services.
A quick way of performing an action or accessing a file.
An electronic or coded message transmitted between systems.
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol, used for sending email.
A saved state of a system or data at a given time.
Programs and operating information used by a computer.
The human-readable code written by programmers.
Structured Query Language, used for database management.
A data structure following the Last-In-First-Out principle.
A single line of code that performs an action.
The retention of data in a computer system.
A continuous flow of data.
A sequence of characters treated as text.
A segmented piece of a larger computer network.
The set of rules defining the structure of code.
A group of interconnected components functioning together.
A structured arrangement of data in rows and columns.
A keyword or label used to categorize or identify data.
A unit of work performed by a computer.
Transmission Control Protocol, used for reliable data transmission.
A pre-designed structure used to create documents or code.
A text-based interface for interacting with a computer system.
A unit recognized by a programming language or system.
A program or utility designed to perform a specific task.
A unit of work performed within a database system.
A hierarchical data structure with nodes and branches.
An event that initiates a predefined action in a system.
Malicious software disguised as legitimate software.
An ordered collection of elements in programming.
User Interface, the part of software users interact with.
A standard for encoding text characters from many languages.
All existing matter and space considered as a whole; the cosmos.
To transfer data from a local system to a remote system.
The amount of time a system has been running without interruption.
Uniform Resource Locator, the address of a resource on the web.
A person who interacts with a computer or system.
A software program designed to help manage or maintain a system.
The process of checking data for accuracy and correctness.
A piece of data stored in a variable or database field.
A named storage location in programming that holds a value.
A one-dimensional array or an object with magnitude and direction.
A specific form or release of a software program.
The creation of virtual computing environments or resources.
Malicious software that replicates itself to infect systems.

The system of interlinked hypertext documents accessible via the internet.

A communication protocol providing full-duplex channels over TCP.
Wireless networking technology allowing devices to connect to the internet.
An area on a computer screen displaying content from a program.

The sequence of steps or processes in completing a task.

A human-readable data serialization format.

A practice combining breath, movement, and meditation.
An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes.
A compressed file format used to reduce file size.
A cable system for sliding from one point to another.
A fastening device with interlocking teeth.
A metallic chemical element with symbol Zn.
